title: Ticket #968: daemon ads contain many copies of sinful string
description:
Daemon ads contain four copies of the address: SubsysIpAddr, MyAddress, PublicNetworkIpAddr, and PrivateNetworkIpAddr. This is overly complicated and we have begun to accumulate potential compatibility complexity where bits of condor pay attention to different attributes.

Since 7.3.0, PrivateNetworkIpAddr is redundant, because the private address and network name are attributes of the full contact string advertised in all of the other attributes. Furthermore, when private network attributes are set, we chose to break compatibility with releases prior to 7.3.0, due to the change in the format of the sinful string, so continuing to support PrivateNetworkIpAddr does not gain us any added backward compatibility.

Prior to 7.2.0, the negotiator depends on startds advertising the same StartdIpAddr or MyAddress in the public and private ads. Beginning in 7.2.0, the collector copies over MyAddress from the public to the private ad.

The collector creates a hash key using SubsysIpAddr. It does not pay attention to MyAddress when doing this, so for backwards compatibility with older collectors, we need to keep advertising SubsysIpAddr.

The daemon client object does not pay attention to MyAddress.

Ads written into a daemon ad file do not contain MyAddress. Only ads sent to the collector do.
remarks:
2009-Nov-17 12:35:56 by danb:
For 7.5.0, I removed PublicNetworkIpAddr and PrivateNetworkIpAddr since this should not create any compatibility problems. I left SubsysIpAddr and MyAddress in place but tried to clean things up so that if we wanted to phase out SubsysIpAddr in the future, we could.

I made the daemon client object pay attention to MyAddress if SubsysIpAddr is not there.

Daemon ad files now contain MyAddress.

The collector now uses MyAddress or SubsysIpAddr when creating hash keys.

2009-Nov-17 13:04:45 by matt:
Can we get a ticket targeting 7.7 that says SubsysIpAddr should be removed before the release of 7.8? Otherwise we're going to forget.

2009-Nov-17 13:31:30 by danb:
Good idea. I added #971 to remind us to remove SubsysIpAddr.
